In these Letters the reader will often be struck by the existence of such bishops in charge of what are apparently very small churches and very limited territories, and in this fact of decentralization he will find the explanation. The same fact very largely accounts for the persistence of Donatism and the violence of its antagonism to the Catholic Church.
